h1.span: Updates on district plans and the Coronavirus

span.strong: All of our buildings will be closed for the remainder of the school year. This is a mandatory closing period directed by the Governor for all districts in the state to be closed.

strong.span: We will continue to educate our students via remote learning through our website and class pages.

We are formulating plans to bring in small groups of students to come in during specific times in order to retrieve items and hand in materials. We hope to have these formalized by the week of April 27th. As soon as we have more direction, we will release these plans.

br.strong: There will be no school events, sports practices or contests during this time period. While the track is open to the public, we ask that students work out in no more than pairs, and maintain distance if more than a few students are there. All fields and playgrounds are closed, including the batting cages.

span.strong: Students should visit building and teacher pages for online assignments. It is important that parents encourage their children to stay active and participate in these lessons and activities.

p.strong: - Nolley resources have been posted on the Nolley page.
- Instructions for lessons and videos for students have been posted on MMS and MHS pages.

"Take and go" breakfast and lunch bags are being provided at no cost for all students grade K-12, on Mondays and Wednesdays from 10:00-11:00 am. Students or parents can pull up outside of the MHS cafeteria kitchen doors. Please see details on the related article here.
Please reach out to your local providers if you do not have internet access at home, as many companies are offering free connection during this time.

span.strong: If you need assistance, please call the central office at 330-882-6926, or send an email to your building administrator.
Students and parents are also encouraged to reach out to our school counselors and psychologists if emotional needs arise during this time.
